page.title: 03THE HOUSE AT SUNDERLAND HALL
page.content: The house at Sunderland Hall is occupied by Mr and Mrs Smyllie. The house was rebuilt about the end of the 1600's by a Mr. Brice. On the same site there was a house in the garden overlooking the Tweed. It was called Sunderland Hall because the land was split (sunderland). Some of the houses were demolished when the Selkirk to Peebles road was straightened. When Mr. and Mrs. Smyllie bought the land they sold cottages and bought back some of the hill ground. Mr. Hunter's house on the Peebles to Selkirk road was once a childrens' home. The children were evacuees from Edinburgh in the Second World War. They used to walk to Selkirk and back on a Sunday for church. Some of them still return to the area to visit.
